alert.note: Alert for Pottawattamie; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 11:55PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pottawattamie and southeastern Shelby Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southeast of Minden, or 16 miles southwest of Harlan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Avoca and Hancock around 1210 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Walnut. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 27 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southwestern Iowa.
